description.p: The product_organization_or_person_in_organization_item type allows for the assignment of organization information to an instance of Product.
A Product represents a product or a type of product. A product is identified by an identifier provided by an organization or a person in an organization.

note.p: A product belongs to one or more categories and may have zero or more versions.
The definition of the domain of uniqueness and the mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of product id are outside the scope of this application module.

explicit.name: id
explicit.description:
the identifier that distinguishes the product.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Part numbers, stock item numbers, and serial numbers are examples of product identifiers.

explicit.name: name
explicit.description: the words by which the product is known.

explicit.name: description
explicit.description: the text which describes the product.

explicit.name: categories
explicit.description:
the instances of the Product_category entity data type that identify categories to which the product belongs.
The product may belong to categories named 'part', 'raw material', 'document', 'functionality', or 'requirement'.
In some early phase of design, a product may not yet be categorized.

inverse.name: actors
inverse.description: the instances of the entity data types organization and person_in_organization that identify actors of the definition of the product.

where.label: WR1
where.description: The product shall have at least one person or organization that has a role on it.

where.label: WR2
where.description: There shall be exactly one actor that is responsible for the designation of the product id.
